title: How to Change Alexa's Name (Wake Word)

steps.title: Say, "Alexa, change your wake word to (name)."
steps.content: Say, "Alexa, change your wake word to (name)." You can use this voice command to change Alexa's name to Amazon, Echo, Computer, or Ziggy. There's no way to give Alexa a custom name, as these are the only options.

steps.title: Open the Alexa app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Alexa app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. If you're not signed in to your Amazon account, you'll be prompted to do so. [1] X Research source If you don't yet have the Alexa app, you can download it from the Google Play Store on Android , or the iOS App Store on iPhone and iPad . You need an app to use Alexa.

steps.title: Tap Devices.
steps.content: Tap Devices . It's the lightbulb icon. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select your Alexa device.
steps.content: Select your Alexa device. This opens your device's settings. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the gear and select Wake Word.
steps.content: Tap the gear and select Wake Word . You'll find the gear icon at the top-right corner of the app. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select a new name.
steps.content: Select a new name. While you can't enter a custom name, you can choose from Amazon , Computer , Echo , or Ziggy [5] X Research source .

steps.title: Tap OK.
steps.content: Tap OK . This saves your new wake word. Now, instead of saying "Alexa" to wake the assistant, you can say the name you chose. [6] X Research source Alexa's new name may take a few minutes to update. You may not be able to use the device during this time.
